result.execSummary:
The defendant David G. Horzewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misconduct/Office-Fail/Perform KnownDuty, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.12(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to any counseling or assessments per agent.  Abide by any no contact orders placed by agent.  Submit to any counseling per agent and DNA sample.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant David G. Horzewski not in court and attorney not in court.  Kevin D. Croninger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives status.  Individuals in court today requesting return of property.  968.20 cited by court.  State takes a light position on the matter of return of property based on evidence surrounding this case.  State cites 968.20.  State does request all firearms requested be returned to rightful owner.  State calls W.S., sworn & testifies regarding property seized.  Request return of firearm.  State has no objection of return.  Court questions W.S.  Court orders return of Remington 742 #292944 to W.S.  Attorney Croninger will drafts orders.  State calls G.L., sworn & testifies regarding property seized.  State advises that A.L. was convicted of felony, making right to possess a firearm unlawful.  State has no objection of return.  Court orders Remington 30/6 returned to G.L.  State calls B.H., sworn & testifies regarding property seized.  No conviction of DNR violation.  Request return of antlers seized.  Court orders return of antlers obtained and held.  State calls J.R., sworn & testifies as to property seized.  Request property be turned over to son, J.R.  No conviction of any DNR violations from incident.  Court questions J.R. regarding son, J.R.'s age.  State approaches with photo of items seized.  Court orders all property seized be returned to son, J.R.  State calls L.W., sworn & testifies as to property seized.  Heir to estate of R.H.  Request return of Ruger M77 to L.W.  Court so orders.  State calls J.E., sworn & testifies as to property seized.  Son to J.E., deceased.  Request return of Winchester 30/30.  Court so orders return of property to D.E, mother.  Witnesses free to leave.  State calls Det. Matthew Dresen, State Capitol Police Dept.  Investigation officer.  State goes through property seized and the attempt to contact the owner.  State request order for disposing of property per statute or return of such property.  Court questions service of such notice.  Court orders disposing of property or return of such property.  State to draft single orders for signature on return of property.
for hearing on return of property pursuant to Wis. Stat. 968.20

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David G. Horzewski in court with attorney Jordan C Loeb.  Kevin D. Croninger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.  Plea to Count 8.  Remaining counts dismissed/read in.  State addresses two restitution requests.  Firearms are in custody.  Request hearing on return of property.  Once hearing takes place, there will no longer be a restitution issue.  Hearing would be heard on ownership of such firearms.  968.20 hearing to be scheduled.  No restitution being ordered today.  Attorney Loeb agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  State gives final sentencing argument.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 8:
3 years Probation
Submit to any conditions per agent.
Abide by any no contact orders per the agent.
Submit to counseling per agent.
Submit to DNA sample
$268.00 costs & $250.00 DNA surcharge & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Paperwork handed in court.
Counts 1-7 Dismissed/read in.

Attorney Loeb takes no position on 968.20 hearing and waives appearance.  State to prepare a request for hearing and list victims requesting return of property.

Defendant David G. Horzewski in court with attorney Jordan C Loeb.  Kevin D. Croninger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews file and pending motions.  State gives status.  Some stipulations have been met.  Attorney Loeb agrees and is consistent with the agreement/stipulations met.  Motions to Inspect withdrawn.  Other motions discussed and procedure.  Discussion to be had re: State's first witness being ready before swearing in jury.  Attorney Loeb continues with other procedural motion.  Agreement reached on para. 9.  Attorney Loeb addresses para. 11 of motion.  No further motions in Limine planned to be filed.  All lay witnesses at trial are scheduled.  No expert testimony.  Court officer named for State.  Sequestration of witnesses.  States motion in Limine granted based on agreements.  Note taking discussed.  State is in favor, Attorney Loeb not in favor.  Court will take concerns, comments under review to make decision on note taking.  Proposed jury instructions by Jan. 7, 2016.

Defendant David G. Horzewski in court with attorney Rachel Ann Krueger & attorney Jordan Loeb.  Kevin Croninger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises parties of a concern of conflict.  Parties agrees no issue re: court's concern.  Motion to Dismiss scheduled for today.  State calls W.S., sworn.  Attorney Lobe motions for sequestration.  Detect. Dresen remains.  All others to leave courtroom.  W.S. testifies re: incident of seized firearm Nov. 2003.  Attorney Loeb cross examines W.S.  State redirect.  Attorney Loeb objects-calls for speculation.  State argues objection.  Court overrules objection.  Attorney Loeb recross.  State request court excuse witness from subpoena.  No objection.  Excused.  State calls D.W.F., sworn & testifies as to incident in 2005 during hunting season.  No questions by defense.  State calls Karl Brooks, sworn & testifies as to policies and procedures of Department.  Deputy Chief Worden for DNR.  Attorney Loeb cross examines.  State objects--calls for legal conclusion.  Attorney Loeb restates question.  State redirects Karl Brooks.  Termination July 2013.  Attorney Loeb recross.  Witness excused.  State calls David Holmes, sworn & testifies as to procedures of the department. Conservation Worden Supervision for DNR.  Attorney Loeb cross examines.  State redirect.  Witness is excused.  State calls Detective Matthew Dresen, State Capitol Police Dept, sworn & testifies.  Attorney Loeb cross examines.  Testimony closed.  State request oral argument.  Gives argument on Motion to Dismiss.  Attorney Loeb request to brief the argument and have it filed by September 29, 2014.  State request rebuttal by October 8, 2014.
State's response to defendant's motions to dismiss
Motion hearing on September 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David G. Horzewski in court with attorney Jordan C Loeb.  Kevin Croninger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court gives status.  Motion to dismiss scheduled.  Time limits continued to be waived.  2nd amended complaint filed today.  Received copy of 2nd amended, waived reading.  Reviewed possible penalties with defendant.  Matter set for Motion to Dismiss.  Bond continues.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant David G. Horzewski in court with attorney Jordan Loeb and Rachel Ann Krueger.  Kevin David Croninger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense recv'd amended complaint.  Atty. Loeb this changes things substantially.  Atty. Loeb hold initial appearance on amended complaint for another date.  Need time to review.  Waive reading of complaint.  Court sets for preliminary hearing.  Bond continues.  State objects to reset.  Atty. Loeb states changing the victim changes this substantially, need time to explore options.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on July 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David G. Horzewski in court with attorney Jordan Loeb.  Kevin Croninger appeared for the State of Wisconsin by phone.  Defense waives reading of complaint.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $5,000.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today, no contact w/E.S.R or his residence, J.R. or his residence, B.P. or his family or their residence, A.L. or his residence, D.F. or his residence.  Atty Croninger requests Atty Loeb simply contact his office informally to discuss the matter or set up a PTC.  Atty Loeb requests two weeks.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.
